definition: to waste (one's breath, one's energy etc)/to try in vain
to twist/crooked/unjust/in vain
to cost/to spend/fee/wasteful/expenses
surname Fei

sentences.english: He tried in vain to write down the movement.
sentences.chinese: 他枉费心机地写文章诋毁这场运动。

sentences.english: I tried to attract her attention, but failed.
sentences.chinese: 我想引起他的注意，却枉费心机。

sentences.english: But when the disciples saw it, they were indignant, saying, Why this waster?
sentences.chinese: 门徒看见，就恼怒说，何必这样枉费。

sentences.english: Ton Pak Fu, don't let us down.
sentences.chinese: 唐伯虎，不要枉费我们的一番心血。

sentences.english: I am afraid of you, lest I have bestowed upon you labour in vain.
sentences.chinese: 我为你们害怕，惟恐我在你们身上是枉费了工夫。
她的谨慎只是枉费心机。

sentences.english: But there were some who were indignantly commenting among themselves: Why has this waste of the ointment been made?
sentences.chinese: 但有几个人恼怒著彼此说，何必这样枉费香膏？

sentences.english: All my love, and glory I'll waste on You.
sentences.chinese: 我所有一切的爱，荣耀，都枉费在你身上。

sentences.english: I am afraid you will be futile.
'In vain, ' quoth she, 'I live, and seek in vain.
sentences.chinese: “我枉自活着，”她说，“而我又枉费心思。

sentences.english: I tried to attract his attention, but failed.
sentences.chinese: 我想要引起他的注意，却枉费心机。

sentences.english: To depend on your memory without studying for a test is to grasp at straws.
sentences.chinese: 应付考试光靠好记性而不用功是枉费心机。

sentences.english: When the disciples saw this, they were indignant. "Why this waste?"
sentences.chinese: 门徒看见，就很不喜悦，说，何用这样的枉费呢。

sentences.english: They tried in vain to write down the movement.
sentences.chinese: 他们试图写文章诋毁这个运动，可是枉费心机。

sentences.english: But when his disciples saw it, they had indignation, saying, To what purpose is this waste?
sentences.chinese: 门徒看见，就很不喜悦，说，何用这样的枉费呢。

sentences.english: Listening to the words to songs that you never bothered listening to before.
sentences.chinese: 聼那些你以前从不愿为此枉费工夫的歌词。

definition: to twist/crooked/unjust/in vain
not in vain
painstaking effort/to take a lot of trouble/laborious at pains
to waste (one's energy etc)
in the end/finally/as a result
to cause or lead to sth bad
to rack one's brains for schemes (idiom)/to beat one's brains out
to be ashamed to face (sb)/to feel bad about having failed (sb)
not to let sb down/to treat sb fairly/be worthy of
fortunately/luckily/(sarcastic) fancy that, how fortunate!
to bother/to press sb, usu. to do sth/it's a tough job/sorry to bother you (polite, used to thank sb for a favor)
one's utmost/(to fight or work) desperately hard/to put up a life or death struggle/at all costs
unable to differentiate good from bad (idiom)/not to know what's good for one/unable to recognize others' good intentions
unable to tell good from bad (idiom)/undiscriminating
lamentable/sad(ly)
to ill-use/to humiliate/to degrade/to ruin/also pr. [zuo2 jian4]
